\section{Generation of MIT 18.02: Multi-Variable Calculus}
\label{sec:generation-18.02}

\begin{longtable}{|l|p{8cm}|p{8cm}|}
\caption{New questions generated from 18.02 Multi-Variable Calculus questions, and the closest question among the existing questions.}\\
\hline
\textbf{ID} & \textbf{Auto-Generated question} & \textbf{Closest question in the dataset}\\
\hline
1 & Find the center and radius of the circle whose polar equation is given. $r   6\sqrt{2\theta-1}$. & Find the center and radius of the circle described in the given equation. $x^2 + 2x + y^2   4$
\\
\hline
2 & Plot the equation $y\frac{x^5}{\sqrt{x}}$ on given interval. Mark the points of maxima. & Plot the parametric curve. $x   e^t, y   4e^2t$
\\
\hline
3 & Find the Maclaurin series of f by series approximating. $f(x)   \tan x; x_0   0, n   4$ & Find the Maclaurin series of the given function f by substitution. $f(x)   \sin 2x$
\\
\hline
4 & Find $a$ x $b$. $a   \langle 9,-2,1 \rangle$, $b   \langle -2,1,1 \rangle$ & Find $a$ x $b$. $a   \langle 5,-1,-2 \rangle$, $b   \langle-3,2,4\rangle$
\\ 
\hline
5 & Find and draw the tangent plane at a given point $z\frac{\sqrt{5}}{2}$. z   $(\sqrt{5}-\sqrt{2},\sqrt{5}+\sqrt{2},0)$ where $x   tan(theta)$ & Write parametric equations of the straight line that passes through the points $P_1$ and $P_2$. $P_1(0,0,0)$, $P_2(-6,3,5)$
\\
\hline
6 & Evaluate for each integral. $\int_{1}^{\pi} \sin(x^2 + y^2) dx \; dy$ & Evaluate the iterated integral. $\int_{0}^{2} \int_{0}^{4} (3x+4y) dx\; dy$
\\
\hline
7 & Eliminate the parameter and display a graph of the elliptic integral of $(x^2(10 - y^2)) * 0)$ & Eliminate the parameter and then sketch the curve. $x   e^t, y   4e^2t$
\\
\hline
8 & Solve for the inverse of $f(x)   e^{2x+1} + e^{3x^2+1}+ \cdots$ Use partial fraction and find the Maclaurin series. & Find the Maclaurin series of the given function f by substitution. $f(x)   \sin 2x$

\\
\hline
9 & Sketch the graph of the improper integral $\int_0^{\pi} (\cos x)\ln x \; dx$ & Sketch the graph of the polar equation. Indicate any symmetries around either coordinate axis or the origin. $r   (2 + 7*\sin(\theta))*(\cos(5*\theta))$
\\
\hline
10 & Find the sum of the infinite power series $\sum_{1}^{\infty}x^n$. $x^2 + x + 1$ & Determine whether the given infinite series converges or diverges. If it converges, find its sum. $1 + 3 + 5 + 7 + \ldots + (2n-1) + \ldots$
\\ \hline
\end{longtable}
title: A Neural Network Solves, Explains, and Generates University Math Problems by Program Synthesis and Few-Shot Learning at Human Level
